intro: Lobivia chionanthas, commonly known as the snow-flower lobivia, is a succulent plant native to the Atacama Desert in Chile. It belongs to the Cactaceae family and is characterized by its short, thick stems and clusters of white, star-shaped flowers. The plant has thick, fleshy leaves that store water, enabling it to survive in arid conditions. It produces a dense mat of foliage that helps it retain moisture and withstand extreme temperatures. Lobivia chionanthas is often cultivated for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
